task.title: Copy Objects
task.shortdesc: You can copy one or more entities, making one copy or multiple copies within the current drawing. You can also copy entities between drawings.

context.p: You can duplicate objects within the current drawing. The default method is to create a selection set and then specify a base point, and a displacement point, for the copy.

While specifying two points, you can enter two coordinates to copy objects with the relative distance. The location of copies is determined by the relative coordinate. You do not have to enter coordinate with the @ as the relative coordinate is assumed.
To copy objects at the specified distance, you can specify the distance directly when the Ortho Mode or Polar Tracking is on.
Create only one copy of object one time

step.cmd: Choose Modify > Copy from the mainmenu.
Select the objects, and then press Enter.
On the command line, type O (mOde).
On the command line, type S (Single).

result.p: Object to copy (A), base point (B), and displacement point (C) Result
You can copy objects more than one time until you press ENTER to exit COPY operation.
Create multiple copies for selected object one time

ol.li: Choose Modify > Copy from the mainmenu.
Select the objects, and then press Enter.
On the command line, type O (mOde).
On the command line, type M (Multiple).
Specify the displacement point of the first copy.
Specify the displacement point of the next copy.
Continue specifying displacement points to place additional copies.
To complete the command, press Enter.

result.p: Left: To make multiple copies of an object, select the object to copy (A), specify the base point (B), and then specify the displacement points (C, D, and E)
